CVXInfo.FullVaccinename: dengue fever vaccine, tetravalent
CVXInfo.Notes: Applies to tetravalent product (e.g. DENGVAXIA)

CVXInfo.FullVaccinename: Dengue fever, unspecified formulation
CVXInfo.Notes: Use this CVX for historical records where; the formulation of the dengue vaccine administered is not known, or is a non-US product without an associated CVX code.

CVXInfo.FullVaccinename: diphtheria antitoxin
diphtheria and tetanus toxoids, adsorbed for pediatric use
CVXInfo.Notes: Retired effective 04/30/2023. All vaccine NDCs retired. No further vaccines expected for this formulation.

CVXInfo.FullVaccinename: Diphtheria, Tetanus, Poliomyelitis adsorbed
CVXInfo.Notes: This code should be used to document non-US vaccines for DT,IPV such as Revaxis

CVXInfo.FullVaccinename: diphtheria, tetanus toxoids and acellular pertussis vaccine
diphtheria, tetanus toxoids and acellular pertussis vaccine, 5 pertussis antigens
diphtheria, tetanus toxoids and acellular pertussis vaccine, unspecified formulation
CVXInfo.Notes: This CVX code allows reporting of a vaccination when formulation is unknown (for example, when recording a DTaP vaccination when noted on a vaccination card)

CVXInfo.FullVaccinename: Diphtheria and Tetanus Toxoids and Acellular Pertussis Adsorbed, Inactivated Poliovirus, Haemophilus b Conjugate (Meningococcal Protein Conjugate), and Hepatitis B (Recombinant) Vaccine.
CVXInfo.Notes: This vaccine is different from CVX 132. Code may be used to document non-US vaccines (e.g. Hexamin) of the same component formulation

CVXInfo.FullVaccinename: DTaP-hepatitis B and poliovirus vaccine
DTaP-Haemophilus influenzae type b conjugate vaccine
diphtheria, tetanus toxoids and acellular pertussis vaccine, Haemophilus influenzae type b conjugate, and poliovirus vaccine, inactivated (DTaP-Hib-IPV)
Diphtheria, tetanus toxoids and acellular pertussis vaccine, and poliovirus vaccine, inactivated
Historical diphtheria and tetanus toxoids and acellular pertussis, poliovirus, Haemophilus b conjugate and hepatitis B (recombinant) vaccine.
CVXInfo.Notes: This is not the same as CVX 146, Hexavalent vaccine.

CVXInfo.FullVaccinename: non-US diphtheria, tetanus toxoids and acellular pertussis vaccine, Haemophilus influenzae type b conjugate, and poliovirus vaccine, inactivated (DTaP-Hib-IPV)
CVXInfo.Notes: This CVX was split off from CVX 102, to correctly identify the contents of the vaccine.

CVXInfo.FullVaccinename: diphtheria, tetanus toxoids and pertussis vaccine
Diphtheria, pertussis, tetanus, hepatitis B, Haemophilus Influenza Type b, (Pentavalent)
CVXInfo.Notes: This represents the non-US pentavalent vaccine. Should be used for historic documentation in US

CVXInfo.FullVaccinename: DTP-Haemophilus influenzae type b conjugate vaccine
DTP- Haemophilus influenzae type b conjugate and hepatitis b vaccine
CVXInfo.Notes: This CVX has been corrected. This non-US vaccine contained DTP, Hib and Hep B. It was withdrawn in 2007 .

CVXInfo.ShortDescription: Ebola Zaire vaccine, live, recombinant, 1mL dose
CVXInfo.FullVaccinename: Ebola Zaire vaccine, live, recombinant, 1mL dose
CVXInfo.Notes: FDA Approved ERVEBO Vaccine.

CVXInfo.FullVaccinename: Ebola, unspecified
hantavirus vaccine
hepatitis B immune globulin
hepatitis A vaccine, adult dosage
Hepatitis A immune globulin
CVXInfo.Notes: Do not use this code. This product may be used for Hep A and other viral infections. The correct vaccine / CVX is 86 (IG).

CVXInfo.FullVaccinename: Hep A, live attenuated-IM
CVXInfo.Notes: This vaccine is not available in the US.

CVXInfo.FullVaccinename: hepatitis A vaccine, pediatric/adolescent dosage, 2 dose schedule
hepatitis A vaccine, pediatric/adolescent dosage, 3 dose schedule
CVXInfo.Notes: This vaccine formulation is inactive and should not be used, except to record historic vaccinations with this formulation.

CVXInfo.FullVaccinename: hepatitis A vaccine, pediatric dosage, unspecified formulation
CVXInfo.Notes: Do NOT use this code. If formulation is unknown, use CVX 85. There is only one formulation of Hep A, peds.

CVXInfo.FullVaccinename: hepatitis A vaccine, unspecified formulation
CVXInfo.Notes: This CVX code allows reporting of a vaccination when formulation is unknown (for example, when recording a HepA vaccination when noted on a vaccination card)

CVXInfo.FullVaccinename: hepatitis A and hepatitis B vaccine
hepatitis A and hepatitis B vaccine, pediatric/adolescent (non-US)
CVXInfo.Notes: e.g. Twinrix Junior available in Canada

CVXInfo.FullVaccinename: hepatitis B vaccine, pediatric or pediatric/adolescent dosage
CVXInfo.Notes: This code applies to any standard pediatric formulation of Hepatitis B vaccine. It should not be used for the 2-dose hepatitis B schedule for adolescents (11-15 year olds). Use code 43 for that vaccine.

CVXInfo.FullVaccinename: hepatitis B vaccine, adolescent/high risk infant dosage
CVXInfo.Notes: As of August 27, 1998, Merck ceased distribution of their adolescent/high risk infant hepatitis B vaccine dosage. Code 42 should only be used to record historical records. For current administration of hepatitis B vaccine, pediatric/adolescent dosage, use code 08.

CVXInfo.FullVaccinename: hepatitis B vaccine, adult dosage
CVXInfo.Notes: This code applies to any standard adult dose and schedule. Also use CVX 43 for the FDA approved Recombivax HB 2-dose hepatitis B schedule for adolescents (11-15 year olds) using the adult formulation.

CVXInfo.ShortDescription: Hep B, high-dosage, dialysis or IC
CVXInfo.FullVaccinename: Hepatitis B vaccine (Hep B), high-dosage, dialysis or immunocompromised patient
CVXInfo.Notes: This code is used record patient high dosage vaccine administration for dialysis or immunocompromised patients. For NDCs that are used for both regular vaccine and dialysis/IC high-dosage schedules (e.g. Engerix-B), are mapped to both CVX 43 and CVX 44. CVX code 44 should be utilized to record dialysis/IC dosing.

CVXInfo.FullVaccinename: hepatitis B vaccine, unspecified formulation
CVXInfo.Notes: This CVX code allows reporting of a vaccination when formulation is unknown (for example, when recording a HepB vaccination when noted on a vaccination card)

CVXInfo.FullVaccinename: hepatitis C vaccine
hepatitis E vaccine
Hepatitis B vaccine (recombinant), 3-antigen, Al(OH)3 adjuvanted
CVXInfo.Notes: Manufacturer VBI has ceased operations - Prehevbrio Hep B vaccine voluntary recall effective 11/15/2024

CVXInfo.FullVaccinename: Hepatitis B vaccine (recombinant), CpG adjuvanted

Haemophilus influenzae type b vaccine, PRP-OMP conjugate

Haemophilus influenzae type b vaccine, conjugate unspecified formulation
Haemophilus influenzae type b conjugate and Hepatitis B vaccine

immune globulin, intravenous

CVXInfo.FullVaccinename: seasonal influenza, intradermal, preservative free
CVXInfo.Notes: IIV3. No US product available since 2014/2015 flu season

CVXInfo.FullVaccinename: influenza, Southern Hemisphere, unspecified formulation
CVXInfo.Notes: This CVX code should be used to record administration of Southern Hemisphere influenza vaccine where formulation is unknown

CVXInfo.FullVaccinename: influenza, seasonal, Southern Hemisphere, high-dose, quadrivalent, 0.7mL dose, preservative free
CVXInfo.Notes: Target population 65 and older, starting Southern Hemisphere season 2023

CVXInfo.ShortDescription: influenza, Southern Hemisphere, pediatric, preservative free
CVXInfo.FullVaccinename: influenza, seasonal, Southern Hemisphere, quadrivalent, pediatric 0.25mL dose, preservative free
CVXInfo.Notes: Pediatric dose for ages 6-35 months

CVXInfo.FullVaccinename: Influenza, seasonal, Southern Hemisphere, quadrivalent, 0.5 mL dose, preservative free
CVXInfo.Notes: Represents single dose vial

CVXInfo.ShortDescription: influenza, Southern Hemisphere, quadrivalent, with preservative
CVXInfo.FullVaccinename: influenza, seasonal, Southern Hemisphere, quadrivalent, 0.5mL dose, with preservative
CVXInfo.Notes: Represents multi-dose vial

CVXInfo.FullVaccinename: Influenza, seasonal, Southern Hemisphere, trivalent, 0.5 mL dose, preservative free
CVXInfo.Notes: Represents single dose vial

CVXInfo.FullVaccinename: influenza virus vaccine, split virus (incl. purified surface antigen)-retired CODE
CVXInfo.Notes: This code is being retired. It will still be found in older immunization records. It included both preservative free and non-preservative free.

CVXInfo.FullVaccinename: Influenza, split virus, quadrivalent, injectable, preservative free
CVXInfo.Notes: Quadrivalent code starting 2013/2014 season

CVXInfo.FullVaccinename: Influenza, split virus, quadrivalent, injectable, contains preservative
CVXInfo.Notes: Quadrivalent code starting 2013/2014 season

CVXInfo.FullVaccinename: Influenza, split virus, trivalent, injectable, preservative free
CVXInfo.Notes: Trivalent code reactivated for 2024/2025 season

CVXInfo.FullVaccinename: Influenza, split virus, trivalent, injectable, contains preservative
CVXInfo.Notes: Trivalent code reactivated for 2024/2025 season

CVXInfo.FullVaccinename: influenza virus vaccine, unspecified formulation
CVXInfo.Notes: This CVX code allows reporting of a vaccination when formulation is unknown (for example, when recording a Influenza vaccination when noted on a vaccination card)

CVXInfo.FullVaccinename: influenza virus vaccine, whole virus
Influenza-avian, H5, unspecified formulation
CVXInfo.Notes: Unspecified code H5xx vaccines to be used when specific formulation is unknown - for vaccines administered starting 2024

Japanese Encephalitis Vaccine SC

CVXInfo.FullVaccinename: Junin virus vaccine
leishmaniasis vaccine
leprosy vaccine

measles and rubella virus vaccine
malaria vaccine
measles virus vaccine
melanoma vaccine
meningococcal A polysaccharide vaccine (non-US)
meningococcal AC polysaccharide vaccine (non-US)
meningococcal ACWY vaccine, unspecified formulation
CVXInfo.Notes: This CVX is intended for use when one of the meningococcal vaccines containing serogroups A, C, W and Y (conjugate or polysaccaride) was given and the exact formulation was not recorded. It should not be used to record newly administered immunizations. It is not to be used when one of the meningococcal vaccines containing other serogroups was administered.

CVXInfo.FullVaccinename: meningococcal B vaccine, recombinant, OMV, adjuvanted
meningococcal B vaccine, fully recombinant
meningococcal B, unspecified formulation
meningococcal C conjugate vaccine
Meningococcal Groups C and Y and Haemophilus b Tetanus Toxoid Conjugate Vaccine
meningococcal polysaccharide (groups A, C, Y, W-135) tetanus toxoid conjugate vaccine 0.5mL dose, preservative free
Meningococcal, MCV4, unspecified conjugate formulation(groups A, C, Y and W-135)
CVXInfo.Notes: This CVX should only be used for historical doses of meningococcal conjugate vaccine where the formulation is unknown (oligosaccharide vs polysaccharide). It is not the same as CVX 108, Meningococcal, unspecified formulation. This CVX is for unspecified Meningococcal conjugate vaccines.

CVXInfo.FullVaccinename: meningococcal oligosaccharide (groups A, C, Y and W-135) diphtheria toxoid conjugate vaccine (MCV4O)
meningococcal polysaccharide (groups A, C, Y and W-135) diphtheria toxoid conjugate vaccine (MCV4P)
meningococcal polysaccharide vaccine (MPSV4)
Meningococcal oligosaccharide conjugated (groups A, C, W, Y) and group B, 0.5 mL, preservative free
CVXInfo.Notes: Meningococcal pentavalent vaccine strains ABCW and Y

CVXInfo.FullVaccinename: Meningococcal polysaccharide (groups A, C, Y, W) tetanus toxoid conjugate, meningococcal B recombinant vaccine, 0.5mL, preservative free
CVXInfo.Notes: Meningococcal pentavalent vaccine strains ABCW and Y

CVXInfo.FullVaccinename: meningococcal vaccine of unknown formulation and unknown serogroups
CVXInfo.Notes: This CVX is intended for use when any one of the meningococcal vaccines is recorded and there is no information about which serogroups are protected against. This code should not be used when a newly administered immunization is recorded.

CVXInfo.FullVaccinename: measles, mumps and rubella virus vaccine
measles, mumps, rubella, and varicella virus vaccine
mumps virus vaccine
no vaccine administered
CVXInfo.Notes: Code 998 was added for use in VXU HL7 messages where the OBX segment is nested with the RXA segment, but the message does not contain information about a vaccine administration. An example of this use is to report the vaccines due next for a patient when no vaccine administration is being reported.

CVXInfo.FullVaccinename: Novel influenza-H1N1-09, injectable
Novel influenza-H1N1-09, all formulations
CVXInfo.Notes: This code is used whenever the actual formulation is not determined or when aggregating all Novel H1N1 Influenza-09 immunizations for reporting to CRA. It should not be used for seasonal influenza vaccine that is not otherwise specified. (NOS)

CVXInfo.FullVaccinename: Novel Influenza-H1N1-09, live virus for nasal administration
Novel influenza-H1N1-09, preservative-free, injectable
Non-US monovalent oral polio vaccine, unspecified formulation
CVXInfo.Notes: This is a non-US vaccine that may be seen in some immunization histories. It is composed of either Type 1, Type 2 or Type 3 oral polio vaccine.

CVXInfo.FullVaccinename: Non-US bivalent oral polio vaccine (types 1 and 3)
CVXInfo.Notes: This is a non-US vaccine that may be seen in some immunization histories.

CVXInfo.FullVaccinename: trivalent poliovirus vaccine, live, oral
CVXInfo.Notes: This is the OPV used in the US from June 1963 through Dec 1999 and globally through April 2016

CVXInfo.FullVaccinename: Oral Polio Vaccine, Unspecified formulation
